description: '''Jewish rock''' is a form of [[contemporary Jewish religious music]] that is influenced by various forms of secular [[rock music]]. Pioneered by contemporary folk artists like Rabbi [[Shlomo Carlebach (musician)|Shlomo Carlebach]] and the [[Diaspora Yeshiva Band]], the genre gained popularity in the 1990s and 2000s with bands like [[Soulfarm]], [[Blue Fringe]], and [[Moshav (band)|Moshav Band]] that appealed to teens and college students, while artists like [[Matisyahu]] enjoyed mainstream crossover success.
